content:
Intent "Attack"

Slot: "Choose Target"
Possible Values: [Enemy A, Enemy B, Enemy C]

Slot "Damage Done"
Possible Values: [RNG from 60 to 100]

Intent "Magic"

Slot: "Choose Spell"
Possible Values: [Fire, Ice, Lightning]

Slot: "Choose Target"
Possible Values: [Enemy A, Enemy B, Enemy C]

Slot "Damage Done"
Possible Values: [RNG 70 to 90]

Intent "Defend"

Slot: "Choose Target"
Possible Values: [Yourself, Ally A, Ally B]

Slot: "Damage Taken"
Possible Values: [RNG 2 to 20]

Intent "Item"

Slot: "Choose Item"
Possible Values: [Healing Potion]

Slot: "Choose Target"
Possible Values: [Yourself, Ally A, Ally B]

Slot: "Health recovered"
Possible Values: [50]
A user is playing an RPG and is the middle of a combat encounter. The above information is the actions the player can take during their turn. Which actions allow the player to target an enemy?

chosen: The attacks intent allows the player to damage one of the enemies with either melee or ranged attacks. The magic spell will also allow the player to choose which enemy they want to target with their spells. Therefore, both attack and magic allow the player to select which enemy they wish to target on their turn.
rejected: The attacks intent allows the player to do damage to an enemy. When choosing which attack to use, the slot "choose target" lets the player select which specific enemy they want to target. Both the magic and defend intents also allow the player to choose which enemy they wish to target in the slots "choose target." Therefore, all three intents - attack, magic, and defend - let the player target an enemy.
snapchosen: The attacks intent allows the player to damage one of the enemies with either melee or ranged attacks. The magic spell will also allow the player to choose which enemy they want to target with their spells. Therefore, both attack and magic allow the player to select which enemy they wish to target on their turn.
snaprejected: The attacks intent allows the player to do damage to an enemy. When choosing which attack to use, the slot "choose target" lets the player select which specific enemy they want to target. Both the magic and defend intents also allow the player to choose which enemy they wish to target in the slots "choose target." Therefore, all three intents - attack, magic, and defend - let the player target an enemy.
